reviewText:
I found Elementary Genocide 2 to be just as informative as Elementary Genocide 1. Kudos!
Shabazz did an exemplary job and I look forward to the next installment in the this documentary series.

Director Rahiem Shabazz back at it again with another hard hitting Documentary further exposes the school to prison pipeline with further critiques and solutions. If you liked Part 1 you will Love Part 2
This was a disappointment.
Every School needs to show this to there teachers!
Awesome, and on time delivery!

Very informative and insightful movie.  It really provides an inside look on how the white supremacist education system attempts at all costs to marginalize and stunt the growth of black boys (and girls as well).  There is definitely a movement going on to dumb down the education system which not only affects black children but white children as well.  Years down the road, the public education system will be the lowest ranked system in the world.  Take a look at the steady growth of the charter school system.  There may be a time where the current public education system may become a thing of the past.
If you haven't seen this you must but be sure you watch Elementary Genocide 1

This is a very informative documentary, I suggest to anyone who has kids, especially black parents with black kids to please watch this dvd. I feel it can help black parents learn about the American school system and how bias it can be, so they could better protect their children.
Great Product.
Very informative and gave you insights into the educational system that is doing nothing to help our children as a result i am seriously looking into home schooling.
.Excellent
Very informational sit my daughter down and we watch it together.
Great

What can I say, what the best video documentaries I've ever bought and I bought quite a few Hidden Colors excetera one two and three you know this but this is definitely one of the best. It's a learning experience a must!
This is one of the most important documentary's for African Americans to understand our modern day problems. I highly recommend this DVD for all.
Very much needed information to be HEARd!!!
GLAD I BOUGHT THIS...VERY EDUCATIONAL, SHARING WITH FAMILY AND FRIENDS
love it
Great watch.....Wish it was longer...
I like this part two better than part one.  The music and sound was better, and the presentation felt better than part one.
It had things talked about that is already mentioned in other videos. I like how there is people being named and who they are int he video, people can contact them for something.

Education is deeper than just grades and test scores. Elementary Genocide 2 speaks to exactly that. The first Elementary Genocide documentary gave us more clarification on the school to prison pipeline problem and left us with a few seeds of thought for next steps. Elementary Genocide 2 provides solutions and thought-provoking insights into how to maintain a healthy community and bypass the prison pipeline. Rahiem Shabazz did a great job of delivering a message that can save generations to come.
Great, right and exact!!
Great info.
good
This DVD brought out information that I had never thought about prior to this piece of work. Great Video.
must see for any black educator!!
The whole family watched this. Very necessary education from inside your home. Make sure your kids watch.
Very informative,  especially if your raising young black men this is a must have documentary.
good
Very informational!

Very educational... A must see for parents who care about their kids. Understanding the educational systems in America. Sad, that our government pays little to no attention to the school systems in the Black communities. This is a wake up call to all Black parents.
Good
